a group of people who adhere to a common faith and habitually attend a given church

a folded part (as in skin or muscle)

examples: he gave the napkins a double fold

examples: fold one's hands, arms, or legs

tr.tran: incorporate a food ingredient into a mixture by repeatedly turning it over without stirring or beating
cease to operate or cause to cease operating
confine in a fold, like sheep

examples: The bed folds in a jiffy

sentence-pair.sentence: One Bible dictionary explains: “In early morning he led forth the flock from the fold, marching at its head to the spot where they were to be pastured.
sentence-pair.taged-sentence: One Bible dictionary explains: “In early morning he led forth the flock from the fold, marching at its head to the spot where they were to be pastured.
sentence-pair.taged-translation: Sebuah kamus Alkitab menjelaskan, ”Pagi-pagi sekali, ia menggiring kawanan domba dari kandang, berjalan di depan mereka menuju tempat merumput.
sentence-pair.translation: Sebuah kamus Alkitab menjelaskan, ”Pagi-pagi sekali, ia menggiring kawanan domba dari kandang, berjalan di depan mereka menuju tempat merumput.
sentence-pair.speech-text: One Bible dictionary explains: “In early morning he led forth the flock from the fold, marching at its head to the spot where they were to be pastured.

sentence-pair.sentence: When a sheep gave birth far from the fold, the caring shepherd would guard the mother during her helpless moments and then pick up the defenseless lamb and carry it to the fold.
sentence-pair.taged-sentence: When a sheep gave birth far from the fold, the caring shepherd would guard the mother during her helpless moments and then pick up the defenseless lamb and carry it to the fold.
sentence-pair.taged-translation: Sewaktu seekor domba melahirkan di tempat yang jauh dari kandangnya, gembala yang penuh perhatian akan menjaga sang induk yang masih lemah kemudian mengambil anaknya yang tak berdaya dan membawanya ke kandang.
sentence-pair.translation: Sewaktu seekor domba melahirkan di tempat yang jauh dari kandangnya, gembala yang penuh perhatian akan menjaga sang induk yang masih lemah kemudian mengambil anaknya yang tak berdaya dan membawanya ke kandang.
sentence-pair.speech-text: When a sheep gave birth far from the fold, the caring shepherd would guard the mother during her helpless moments and then pick up the defenseless lamb and carry it to the fold.

sentence-pair.sentence: The flocks of one man or sometimes of several would be kept in the fold during the night with a doorkeeper to keep watch and to protect them.
sentence-pair.taged-sentence: The flocks of one man or sometimes of several would be kept in the fold during the night with a doorkeeper to keep watch and to protect them.
sentence-pair.taged-translation: Kawanan domba milik satu orang atau kadang-kadang milik beberapa orang dimasukkan ke dalam kandang pada waktu malam dan ada seorang penjaga pintu yang menjaga dan melindungi domba-domba itu.
sentence-pair.translation: Kawanan domba milik satu orang atau kadang-kadang milik beberapa orang dimasukkan ke dalam kandang pada waktu malam dan ada seorang penjaga pintu yang menjaga dan melindungi domba-domba itu.
sentence-pair.speech-text: The flocks of one man or sometimes of several would be kept in the fold during the night with a doorkeeper to keep watch and to protect them.

sentence-pair.sentence: At night he brought the flock home to the fold, counting them as they passed under the rod at the door to assure himself that none were missing. . . .
sentence-pair.taged-sentence: At night he brought the flock home to the fold, counting them as they passed under the rod at the door to assure himself that none were missing. . . .
sentence-pair.taged-translation: Pada malam hari, ia membawa kawanan pulang ke kandang, menghitung seraya domba-domba itu satu per satu lewat di bawah tongkatnya sebelum memasuki pintu kandang untuk memastikan bahwa tidak ada satu pun yang hilang. . . .
sentence-pair.translation: Pada malam hari, ia membawa kawanan pulang ke kandang, menghitung seraya domba-domba itu satu per satu lewat di bawah tongkatnya sebelum memasuki pintu kandang untuk memastikan bahwa tidak ada satu pun yang hilang. . . .
sentence-pair.speech-text: At night he brought the flock home to the fold, counting them as they passed under the rod at the door to assure himself that none were missing. . . .

sentence-pair.sentence: He leads them forth from the fold, or from their houses in the villages, just where he pleases.

sentence-pair.taged-translation: Ia menuntun mereka keluar dari kandang, atau dari rumah mereka di desa, ke mana pun ia kehendaki.

sentence-pair.sentence: Perhaps the sealing was done by folding the deed closed, tying it with a cord, and then putting a lump of wax or other soft substance on the cord and impressing the soft material with a seal.

sentence-pair.taged-translation: Mungkin pemeteraian ini dilakukan dengan melipat akta tersebut rapat-rapat, lalu mengikatnya dengan seutas tali, dan kemudian menaruh gumpalan lilin atau zat lunak lain pada tali itu dan membubuhkan cap meterai padanya.

tran_entry.tran: If you fold something such as a piece of paper or cloth, you bend it so that one part covers another part, often pressing the edge so that it stays in place

sent.eng_sent: The back of the bench folds forward to make a table.
This portable seat folds flat for easy storage.

tran_entry.tran: If a piece of furniture or equipment folds or if you can fold it, you can make it smaller by bending or closing parts of it

sent.eng_sent: When not in use it folds up out of the way.

tran_entry.tran: Fold up means the same as . fold up

sent.eng_sent: Meer folded his arms over his chest and turned his head away.

tran_entry.tran: If you fold your arms or hands, you bring them together and cross or link them, for example, over your chest
to mix (a whisked mixture) with other ingredients by gently turning one part over the other with a spoon

sent.eng_sent: Make another fold and turn the ends together.

tran_entry.tran: A fold in a piece of paper or cloth is a bend that you make in it when you put one part of it over another part and press the edge

sent.eng_sent: The priest fumbled in the folds of his gown.

tran_entry.tran: The folds in a piece of cloth are the curved shapes which are formed when it is not hanging or lying flat
a small enclosure or pen for sheep or other livestock, where they can be gathered
the sheep or other livestock gathered in such an enclosure
a church or the members of it
